metadata.title: CVE-2020-15655 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A redirected HTTP request which is observed or modified through a web extension could bypass existing CORS checks, leading to potential disclosure of cross-origin information. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.1, Firefox < 79, and Thunderbird < 78.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-15655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
